definition: to rebuke angrily
to scold/shout at/to hoot at
see 叱咤[chi4 zha4]
lit. to rebuke Heaven and Earth (idiom); fig. shaking the whole world/all-powerful
lit. to rebuke Heaven and Earth (idiom); fig. shaking the whole world/all-powerful
to inspire awe
lit. to proclaim oneself hegemon/to take a leading role/to build a personal fiefdom
to consider oneself unexcelled in the world/to be insufferably arrogant
a powerful chief of the princes of the Spring and Autumn Period (770-476 BC)/overlord/hegemon
to call the wind and summon the rain (idiom); to exercise magical powers/fig. to stir up troubles
the man (or woman) of the moment (idiom)/influential figure

lit. warp and weft in weaving; vertically and horizontal/length and breadth/criss-crossed/able to move unhindered/abbr. for 合縱連橫|合纵连横[He2 zong4 Lian2 heng2], School of Diplomacy during the Warring States Period (475-221 BC)
to sweep everything before one/to be invincible (idiom)
weather/unstable situation
legendary person/legend (i.e. person)
splendid/glorious
resounding/loud/well known/famous
